ticTacToe

Class Policy

  • java.lang.Object
    • ticTacToe.Policy
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AggressivePolicy, DefensivePolicy, EpsilonGreedyPolicy, RandomPolicy

    public class Policy
extends java.lang.Object
    A Tic Tac Toe Policy implemented via a HashMap

    ae187

    • Constructor Detail

      • Policy

        public Policy(java.util.HashMap<Game,Move> policy)
        Create policy according to this map
        Parameters:

      • Policy

        public Policy()

      • Policy

        public Policy(java.lang.String file)
        loads policy from file. One possible format for storing a policy is as a sequence of lines where each line specifies the action/move determined by the policy in a particular game state. The game states should not explicitly stored, only their hashes are stored. The Game object itself can be constructed using the Game.inverseHash(int) method.
        Parameters:
        file -

    • Method Detail

      • getMove

        public Move getMove(Game g)
        Default behaviour here is that if the game state is not in the policy map policy then the policy returns null. You can override this method for different behaviours, e.g. returning a random move if this happens.
        Parameters:
        g -
        Returns:
